chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

BSM_PROBLEM = {n : nat & {_ : nat & {_ : list (bsm_instr n) & vec (list bool) n}}} : Set
reduces_transitive : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (Q : Y -> Prop) (Z : Type) (R : Z -> Prop), P ⪯ Q -> Q ⪯ R -> P ⪯ R
red_comp : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (q : Y -> Prop), p ⪯ q -> (fun x : X => ~ p x) ⪯ (fun y : Y => ~ q y)
MM_HALTING = fun P : MM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := P in let (P0, v) := s in sss_terminates (mm_sss (n:=n)) (1, P0) (1, v) : MM_PROBLEM -> Prop
reduces_reflexive : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), P ⪯ P
BSM_MM_HALTS_ON_ZERO = let f := fun H : BSM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := H in let (i, s0) := s in let (P, v) := s0 in let s1 := bsm_mm_compiler_2 i P in let (Q, _) := s1 in existT (fun n0 : nat => {_ : list (mm_instr (pos n0)) & vec nat n0}) (2 + n) (existT (fun _ : list (mm_instr (pos (2 + n))) => vec nat (2 + n)) Q (0 ## 0 ## vec_map stack_enc v)) in ex_intro (fun f0 : BSM_PROBLEM -> MM_PROBLEM => reduction f0 BSM_HALTING MM_HALTS_ON_ZERO) f (fun x : BSM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) as s return (BSM_HALTING s <-> MM_HALTS_ON_ZERO (f s)) := x in let (i, s0) as s0 return (BSM_HALTING (existT (...
reduces_dependent : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (Y : Type) (Q : Y -> Prop), P ⪯ Q < -> inhabited (forall x : X, {y : Y | P x <-> Q y})
VectorDef.splitat : forall l r : nat, vec ?A (l + r) -> vec ?A l * vec ?A r where ?A : [f := fun H : BSM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := H in let (i, s0) := s in let (P, v) := s0 in let s1 := bsm_mm_compiler_1 i P in let (Q, _) := s1 in existT (fun n0 : nat => {_ : list (mm_instr (pos n0)) & vec nat n0}) (2 + n) (existT (fun _ : list (mm_instr (pos (2 + n))) => vec nat (2 + n)) Q (0 ## 0 ## vec_map stack_enc v)) : BSM_PROBLEM -> MM_PROBLEM |- Type]
VectorDef.rectS : forall P : forall n : nat, vec ?A (S n) -> Type, (forall a : ?A, P 0 (a ## vec_nil)) -> (forall (a : ?A) (n : nat) (v : vec ?A (S n)), P n v -> P (S n) (a ## v)) ->...-> MM_PROBLEM |- Type]
pos_S_inv : forall p : pos (S ?n), (p = pos0) + {q : pos ?n | p = pos_nxt q} where ?n : [f := fun H : BSM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := H in let (i, s0) := s in let (P, v) := s0 in let s1 := bsm_mm_compiler_1 i P in let (Q, _) := s1 in existT (fun n0 : nat => {_ : list (mm_instr (pos n0)) & vec nat n0}) (2 + n) (existT (fun _ : list (mm_instr (pos (2 + n))) => vec nat (2 + n)) Q (0 ## 0 ## vec_map stack_enc v)) : BSM_PROBLEM -> MM_PROBLEM |- nat]

Inductive ZArithProof : Type := DoneProof : ZMicromega.ZArithProof | RatProof : ZMicromega.ZWitness -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof | CutProof : ZMicromega.ZWitness -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof | EnumProof : ZMicromega.ZWitness -> ZMicromega.ZWitness -> list ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof | ExProof : BinNums.positive -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof Arguments ZMicromega.EnumProof _ _ _%list_scope Arguments ZMicromega.ExProof _%positive_scope

reduction = fun (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (P : X -> Prop) (Q : Y -> Prop) => forall x : X, P x < -> Q (f x) : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Y) -> (X -> Prop) -> (Y -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments reduction {X Y}%type_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope
compiler_correction.gen_compiler_terminates : forall (X Y : Set) (icomp : (nat -> nat) -> nat -> X -> list Y) (ilen : X -> nat), (forall (lnk : nat -> nat) (n : nat) (x : X), length (icomp lnk n x) = ilen x) -> forall (state_X state_Y : Type) (step_X : X -> nat * state_X -> nat * state_X -> Prop) (step_Y : Y -> nat * state_Y -> nat * state_Y -> Prop), (forall (I : X) (st1 : nat * state_X), exists st2 : nat * state_X, step_X I st1 st2) -> (forall (I : Y) (st st1 st2 : nat * state_Y), step_Y I st st1 -> step_Y I st st2 -> st1 = st2) -> forall simul : state_X -> state_Y ->...-> sss_terminates step_X (fst P, snd P) (fst P, v)
compiler_correction.gen_compiler_complete : forall (X Y : Set) (icomp : (nat -> nat) -> nat -> X -> list Y) (ilen : X -> nat), (forall (lnk : nat -> nat) (n : nat) (x : X), length (icomp lnk n x) = ilen x) -> forall (state_X state_Y : Type) (step_X : X -> nat * state_X -> nat * state_X -> Prop) (step_Y : Y -> nat * state_Y -> nat * state_Y -> Prop), (forall (I : X) (st1 : nat * state_X), exists st2 : nat * state_X, step_X I st1 st2) -> (forall (I : Y) (st st1 st2 : nat * state_Y), step_Y I st st1 -> step_Y I st st2 -> st1 = st2) -> forall simul : state_X -> state_Y ->...-> sss_terminates step_X (fst P, snd P) (i1, v1)

```coq
intros.
apply reduces_transitive with (Q := MM_HALTS_ON_ZERO).
- apply red_comp.
  apply reduces_dependent.
  exists f.
  intros x.
  split; intros.

  + apply BSM_MM_HALTS_ON_ZERO.
- apply reduces_reflexive.
Qed.```
